data.question: What is the band gap energy of the Cu(I) coordination polymer mentioned?
What type of light source was used in the photocatalytic experiments?
Does the Cu(I) coordination polymer exhibit mechanochromic properties?
What happens to the emission spectrum of the Cu(I) coordination polymer upon mechanical grinding?
data.answer: It displays an obvious red shift about 160 nm

data.question: Can the ground sample of the Cu(I) coordination polymer recover its original crystalline phase upon exposure to solvent?
What is the photocatalytic efficiency of the Cu(I) coordination polymer for the degradation of methylene blue after 20 minutes?
Is the Cu(I) coordination polymer capable of sensing nitrobenzene?
What structural feature is prominent in the Cu(I) coordination polymer?
data.answer: The presence of the helical 21 chains formed from m2-dm-bim ligands and 2-coordinate Cu+ centers

data.question: How does the Cu(I) coordination polymer respond to mechanical grinding?
data.answer: By exhibiting a pressure-induced luminescent change

data.question: What is the degradation time for RhB using the Cu(I) coordination polymer as a photocatalyst?
Does the Cu(I) coordination polymer retain its photocatalytic efficiency after repeated use?
What is the effect of nitrobenzene on the photoluminescent properties of the Cu(I) coordination polymer?
data.answer: It causes unique fluorescence quenching behavior

data.question: Is the crystalline sample of the Cu(I) coordination polymer stable in air?
What is the role of the dm-bim ligand in the structure of the Cu(I) coordination polymer?
data.answer: It links two Cu+ centers, contributing to the formation of helical chains

data.question: How does the Cu(I) coordination polymer's structure change upon mechanical grinding?
data.answer: The crystal lattice is significantly disrupted, leading to a crystal-to-amorphous phase conversion

data.question: Can the Cu(I) coordination polymer detect other solvents besides nitrobenzene?
What is the degradation percentage of MO after 45 minutes using the Cu(I) coordination polymer?
Does the Cu(I) coordination polymer show a chiral feature?
What contributes to the photoemission of the Cu(I) coordination polymer?
data.answer: The [Cu - p*(dm-bim)] metal-to-ligand charge transfer (MLCT) and possibly Cu...Cu cluster-centered excited states

data.question: Is the Cu(I) coordination polymer insoluble in common solvents?
